Full Detail Tutorials
=====================

.. warning::

   ⚠️ **Important Notice**: This section is under development. Full detail tutorials will be added in future releases.

Comprehensive tutorials covering all aspects of the CANNs library, organized by functionality.

.. toctree::
   :maxdepth: 2
   :caption: Tutorials:

   Coming Soon

Tutorial Structure
------------------

**3.1 Model Collections**
   Comprehensive guides for all model types

   - **3.1.1 Basic Models** - CANN1D, CANN2D, and their variants
   - **3.1.2 Hybrid Models** - Combined and extended architectures
   - **3.1.3 Brain-Inspired Models** - Hopfield networks, spiking models, and more

**3.2 Task Generators**
   Creating experimental paradigms and task data

   - **3.2.1 Tracking Tasks** - Smooth tracking, oscillatory tracking, population coding
   - **3.2.2 Navigation Tasks** - Open-loop, closed-loop, and spatial navigation

**3.3 Analysis Methods**
   Tools and techniques for analyzing models and data

   - **3.3.1 Model Analyzer** - Dynamics analysis, bump analysis, energy landscapes
   - **3.3.2 Experimental Data Analyzer** - Fitting real neural data, preprocessing pipelines
   - **3.3.3 RNN Dynamics Analyzer** - Fixed point analysis, slow point detection

**3.4 Brain-Inspired Training**
   Learning rules and training frameworks

   - Hebbian learning
   - STDP (Spike-Timing Dependent Plasticity)
   - BCM (Bienenstock-Cooper-Munro) rule
   - Oja's rule and Sanger's rule
   - Custom training loops
